metadata.case_name: Appellant (Plaintiff) v. Ex-Ruler of Jaipur & Ors.

facts.text: Suit filed by appellant for recovery of Rs. 23,998-12-0 as price of goods supplied in 1947 to Ruler of Jaipur State, including interest and damages due to refusal to take delivery of other goods ordered.
Defendants joined: ex-Ruler of Jaipur (defendant 1), Military Secretary (defendant 2), Mohabat Singh (defendant 3), alleged to have placed orders as agents of ex-Ruler.
ex-Ruler raised plea that suit incompetent without consent of Central Government under s. 87-B CPC.
Other defendants denied claim and liability.
Subordinate Judge held suit cannot be continued against ex-Ruler without consent; adjourned for 4 months to obtain consent; consent refused by Central Government.
Appellant applied in revision to Judicial Commissioner contending s.87-B offends Art.14; rejected.
Suit dismissed against all defendants: against ex-Ruler no consent; against others protected by s.230 ICA, s.230(3) inapplicable.
Appeal to Judicial Commissioner, Ajmer (Civil First Appeal No. 3 of 1956), dismissed; judgment dated September 5, 1956.
Certificate under Arts. 132 and 133(1)(c) granted by High Court of Rajasthan post-Reorganisation.
Military Secretary (defendant 2) died; appeal not directed against him.
Mohabat Singh signed letters for Military Secretary; not acting as agent of ex-Ruler but performing ministerial act.

legal_issues.text: Whether s. 87-B of CPC is ultra vires Art. 14 of Constitution.
Whether s. 87-B applies to suit pending when enacted.
Whether Mohabat Singh liable as agent or sub-agent under s. 230(3) of Indian Contract Act.

petitioner_arguments.text: s. 87-B ultra vires Art.14 as discriminates in favour of ex-Rulers by creating immunity from civil actions.
s. 87-B, even if valid, cannot apply to pending suit; substantive right to continue suit cannot be taken away without express words or necessary intendment.
Mohabat Singh liable as agent or sub-agent; s.230(3) ICA applicable.

respondent_arguments.text: Suit incompetent without consent under s.87-B CPC.
Defendants protected by s.230 ICA; s.230(3) inapplicable as suit could be filed against ex-Ruler with consent.

court_reasoning.text: ex-Rulers form a class based on historical considerations; special legislation valid under Art.14 as based on real and substantial distinction related to object.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Privilege of ex-territoriality continued from pre-Constitution s.86; Art.362 respects covenants assuring personal rights, privileges, dignities including immunity.

court_reasoning.text: Word 'sued' in s.86(1) read with s.87-B includes not only initiation but continuation of suit; applies to pending actions due to amplitude of language.
court_reasoning.key_observation: No need for express retrospectivity; pending suits affected unless saved.

court_reasoning.text: Mohabat Singh not agent of ex-Ruler; merely signed letters for Military Secretary as ministerial act.

holdings.text: s. 87-B CPC not ultra vires Art.14; valid classification based on history.
s. 87-B applies to pending suits; consent necessary for continuation.
No liability for Mohabat Singh under s.230 ICA.

precedents_cited.relevance: Principles on retrospectivity of laws affecting pending actions.

precedents_cited.case_name: Garikapatti Veeraya v. N. Subbiah Choudhury
K.C. Mukherjee v. Mst. Ram Ratan Kuer
precedents_cited.relevance: Language rebuts presumption against affecting vested rights.

statutes_cited.name: Code of Civil Procedure
statutes_cited.relevance: Provisions on suits against Rulers; s.87-B applies protections of s.86 to ex-Rulers of former Indian States.

statutes_cited.name: Indian Contract Act
statutes_cited.relevance: Protection to agents of ex-Ruler; sub-s.(3) inapplicable.

statutes_cited.name: Constitution of India
statutes_cited.relevance: Art.14 equality; Art.362 guarantees to Rulers; others procedural.

outcome.summary: Appeal dismissed; suit incompetent against ex-Ruler without Central Government consent under s.87-B CPC, which is valid and applies to pending suits; no liability for Mohabat Singh.

key_quotes.text: "The word sued means not only the filing of a suit or a civil proceeding but also their pursuit through Courts."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Interprets scope of s.86(1)/87-B to include continuation of pending suits.

key_quotes.text: "The ex-Rulers form a class and the special legislation is based upon historical considerations applicable to them as a class."
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: "Immunity from civil action may be described also as a privilege, because the word Privilege is sufficiently wide to include an immunity."
key_quotes.speaker: court
